intro: Gardenia abbeokutae, commonly known as the Abbeokuta gardenia, is a flowering plant native to western Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are often used in traditional medicine and as ornamental plants due to their beauty and scent. The fruit produced by the plant is a red, fleshy berry that contains several seeds.
